text.tspan: get product info(package ID, auth code)
get product info(Merkle tree, auth code)
product info (for a whole box / box set)
product info (for a whole box / box set)
The idea of the authentication code is to bind the QR code to the information about a specific box, at each IoT platform. It should look like a random code and
be unpredictable, i.e. so that it can be constructed only with the knowledge of the box where the package was packed from.
The details remain to be worked out.
1. Assume the each of the grape boxes has a
Will the boxes be reused? Will they contain the same serial number?
is stored into the IoT database
3. Formulate the database query to include the
i.e. these are the authorized part of the database query.
into the transaction in the private ledger.
5. Store the transaction IDs of the private transactions into the public ledger transaction.
6. Compute the authentication code as follows:
auth = nonce, hash(nonce, serial number, Merkle tree of private transaction IDs)
Now, the nonce (a short random number) is part of the authentication code itself.
The authentication code is bound to the box, since it contains the box serial number.
The authentication code is bound to the private ledger transactions, since it contains their IDs.
The public ledger does not need to know the serial number, as it is found from the private ledgers. Hence, the universal link does not reveal the box.
The private ledger transaction IDs are stored in the public ledger as a Merkle tree, not revealing them.
- this may not work, as how to then query the private ledger?
